Class Job

java.lang.Object
Job
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Job>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CompoundJob
public class Job
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Job>
this class stores the characteristics of a job
Author:
Omar Loudghiri

  • Constructor Details

    • Job

      public Job​(int id, int earliestStart, int deadline, int duration, int profit)
      creates an instance of a job and initializes the values of the job
      Parameters:
      id - the identification of that job
      earliestStart - the earliest time this job can start
      deadline - by what time the job needs to be done
      duration - how long the job will take
      profit - how much money will the completion of this job make

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
      the equals method compares Jobs by comparing their id, if the id is the same then they are equal
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      other - the object we are comparing the job to
      Returns:
      true if same id, false if different id, false if not a job

      a the default compareto method that compares the jobs by
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Job>
      Parameters:
      other - the object that the instance calling the method will be compared to
      Returns:
      true if they have the same id, false if different
